books.title: C# - Black Book
books.creator: Matt Telles
books.shortDesc: C# (pronounced see sharp, like the musical note C♯, but written with the number sign) is a general-purpose, multi-paradigm programming language encompassing strong typing, lexically scoped, imperative, declarative, functional, generic, object-oriented (class-based), and component- oriented programming disciplines.

physicalLocation.name: 42 Collection
physicalLocation.shortDesc: This collection is a veritable treasure trove of the educational, weird and wonderful! You will find books on popular science, history and philosphy of science and things you didn't even know you had a question for.

books.title: Hands-on Genetic Algorithms with Python
books.creator: Eyal Wirsansky
books.shortDesc: This book gives you experience making genetic algorithms work for you, using easy-to-follow example problems that you can fall back upon when learning to use other machine learning tools and techniques. ... then progress toward optimizing one genetic algorithm with another, and finally genetic programming.

physicalLocation.name: 42 Collection
physicalLocation.shortDesc: This collection is a veritable treasure trove of the educational, weird and wonderful! You will find books on popular science, history and philosphy of science and things you didn't even know you had a question for.

books.title: Programming Rust
books.creator: Jim Blandy & Jason Orendorff
books.shortDesc: Rust is a multi-paradigm programming language focused on performance and safety, especially safe concurrency. Rust is syntactically similar to C++, and provides memory safety without using garbage collection, but instead through the use of a borrow checking system.

physicalLocation.name: Main Book Collection
physicalLocation.shortDesc: This is a collection of science books from all major fields of natural science and related fields. For books older than 2007, see the specific subject collections.

books.title: Kotline Standard Library cookbook
books.creator: Samuel Urbanowicz
books.shortDesc: Kotlin is a cross-platform, statically typed, general-purpose programming language with type inference. Kotlin is designed to inter operate fully with Java, and the JVM version of Kotlin's standard library depends on the Java Class Library, but type inference allows its syntax to be more concise.

physicalLocation.name: Main Book Collection
physicalLocation.shortDesc: This is a collection of science books from all major fields of natural science and related fields. For books older than 2007, see the specific subject collections.

books.title: THE KNG OF DRUGS
books.creator: NORA BARRETT
books.shortDesc: More than two decades after his death, Pablo Escobar remains as well known as he was during his heyday as the head of the Medellín drug cartel. His fixture in popular culture is largely thanks to countless books, movies, and songs.

physicalLocation.name: SciFi Collection
physicalLocation.shortDesc: This collection has around ten thousand SciFi books and videos. In this sandbox of the mind you will find the inception of many real scientific theories and technologies as well as ideas that will challenge and inspire.

books.title: Human Computer Interaction Fundamentals
books.creator: Andrew Sears Julie A. Jacko
books.shortDesc: This book is a rigorous review of the field of human-computer interactions. It provides historical background of different devices that exist and have existed for humans to interact with machines, and so on. As such, it does a good job.

physicalLocation.name: SciFi Collection
physicalLocation.shortDesc: This collection has around ten thousand SciFi books and videos. In this sandbox of the mind you will find the inception of many real scientific theories and technologies as well as ideas that will challenge and inspire.

directions.directions: Go up the stairs, straight into the main library hall and pass the reception on your left
Turn right, go to the end of the mesanine, and then turn right again through the corridor
Go out of the main hall, down the stairs to the left, then go to the end of the mesanine, and turn right through the corridor
Go out of the main hall, down the stairs to the left
Go left through the corridor, turn left until you come to the stairs and turn left again
Go left through the corridor, turn left until you come to the stairs, go up the stairs straight into the main library hall and pass the reception on your left
